Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution, de novo designed, man-made sequences

Literature.Author: Wang C, Shao C, Fang Y, Wang J, Dong N, Shan A. 2021
Literature.Title: Binding loop of sunflower trypsin inhibitor 1 serves as a design motif for proteolysis-resistant antimicrobial peptides.

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (42.86%) toRetrocyclin-3I: 33%; R: 22%; C=P: 11%.  GRAVY: 0.25; M Wt:  2224.817; Mol formula:  C100H175N32O21S2; molar extinction coeff: 5675.Activity: active against Gram- E. coli ATCC 25922 or UB1005 or K88 or K99 strains (MIC 16-32 uM), S. pullorum 7913 (MIC 16 uM),  S. enterica serovar Typhimurium C7731 or 14208 (MIC 32 uM),P. aeruginosa (MIC 32 uM), S. choleraesuis CVCC503 (MIC 32 uM), S. aureus ATCC 29213 or 29523 or MRSA 43300 (MIC 16-32 uM), S. epidermidis 12228 (MIC 16 uM), E. faecalis 29212 (MIC 8 uM).Antimicrobial robustness:  NaCl-insensitive:E. coli (150 mM salt); KCl-insensitive:E. coli (4.5 mM salt); NH4Cl-insensitive:E. coli (6 uM salt); MgCl2-insensitive:E. coli (1 mM salt); ZnCl2-insensitive:E. coli (8 uM salt); FeCl3-insensitive:E. coli (4 uM salt); NaCl-sensitive:S. aureus (150 mM salt); KCl-insensitive:S. aureus (4.5 mM salt); NH4Cl-sensitized:S. aureus (6 uM salt); MgCl2-insensitive:S. aureus (1 mM salt); CaCl2-sensitive:S. aureus (2 mM salt); ZnCl2-insensitive:S. aureus (8 uM salt); FeCl3-insensitive:S. aureus (4 uM salt).Toxicity: 10% hemolysis concentration > 128 uM (poor hemo.lytic).classification upadted 10/2024
